metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13286 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in the functionJBIG2Stream::readTextRegionSeg() located at JBIG2Stream.cc. It can, forexample, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftoppmtool. It might allow an attacker to cause Information Disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13286` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xpdf: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
poppler package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.14').
